definition: (have sb in) the palm of one's hand/fig. (under) one's complete control

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: China is brilliant at playing divide and rule among individual EU countries.
sentences.chinese: 中國玩弄歐盟單個國家於股掌之間。

sentences.english: People always like to think that they can beat the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 人們總覺得自己能夠玩弄市場於股掌之中。

sentences.english: Virginia is hosting an institution that the Kochs practically control.
sentences.chinese: 弗吉尼亞州的這所大學實際上已經在科氏股掌之間了。

definition: to play with/to toy with/to dally with/to engage in/to resort to
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
within the range of a bow and arrow/(fig.) under sb's control
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
to slaughter/(fig.) to ride roughshod over/to take advantage of (others)
to place sb on field of death/to confront with mortal danger/to give sb no way out/with one's back to the wall/looking death in the eye/part of idiom 置之死地而後生|置之死地而后生
the power of sb or sth evil/the clutches (of a bad person etc)
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
lit. to turn over one's palm/fig. everything is going very well.
